turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: You were with him at the end.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I was watching.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I longed to be with him. But I wanted his final moments to have peace. I could see you were a friend to him.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: What is that to you? Evil as you are.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I am as he made me. In his own image.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: You drove him to his torment.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: And he drove me to mine.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Then why weep for him?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Would you not? He was father. And mother. We fell from grace together. He from his God. I from mine.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I've never been shown a kindness. Show me one now.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: What kindness?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Build for him a pyre. Light up the sky with his passing.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Nice.

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: The music? Or the fire?

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: I'm glad you finally came to the door. A man shouldn't have to scurry in the shadows.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Better that way... for me.

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I'm... very, very ugly. People are afraid. Except you.

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: It can't be as bad as that.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Worse.

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: You're an outcast.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Yes. I have been seeking my friends.

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: Friends? Do they live around here?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Yes. Very close

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: Why do you not go to them?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I have been... afraid. Afraid... they will hate me... because I am so very ugly... and they are so very beautiful

turns.speaker: GRANDFATHER
turns.text: People can be kinder than you think.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I am afraid.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Come warm yourself if you like.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: You speak.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Yes, I speak. And read. And think... and know the ways of Man.  I've been waiting for you. Two months now.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: How did you find me?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: The letters in your journal. That and a geography book.  Your Elizabeth sounds lovely.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Kill me and have done with it.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Kill you? Hardly that.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Then why am I here? What did you want with me?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: More to the point, why am I here? What did you want with me?  What does one say to one's Maker, having finally met him face to face? Milton gave it voice.  Did I request thee, Maker, from my clay to mould me Man? Did I solicit thee from Darkness to promote me?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Fine words from a child killer. You who murdered my brother.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Your crime... as well as mine.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: How dare you. You're disgusting and evil.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Evil?  Do you believe in evil?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I see it before me.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I'm not sure I believe. But then I had no one to instruct me. I had no mother... and my father abandoned me at birth.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Why, Victor? Why? What were you thinking?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: There was something at work in my soul which I do not understand.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: What of my soul? Do I have one? Or was that a part you left out?  Who were these people of which I am comprised? Good people? Bad people?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Materials. Nothing more.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: You're wrong. Do you know I knew how to play this?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: In which part of me did this knowledge reside? In these hands? In this mind? In this heart?  And reading and speaking. Not things learned... so much as things remembered.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Trace memories in the brain, perhaps.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Stolen memories. Stolen and hazy. They taunt me in my dreams. I've seen a beautiful woman lying back and beckoning for me to love her. Whose woman was this? I've seen boys playing, splashing about in a stream. Whose childhood friends were these?  Who am I?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Then perhaps I believe in evil after all.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: What can I do?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: There is something I want.  A friend.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Friend?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: A companion. A female. Like me, so she won't hate me.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Like you? Oh, God, you don't know what you're asking.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I do know that for the sympathy of one living being, I would make peace with all.  I have love in me the likes of which you can scarcely imagine. And rage the likes of which you would not believe. If I cannot satisfy the one, I will demonically indulge the other. That choice is yours.  You're the one who set this in motion, Frankenstein.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: And if I consent?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: We'd travel north, my bride and I. To the furthest reaches of the Pole, where no man has ever set foot. There we would live out our lives. Together.  No human eye would ever see us again. This I vow.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Soon?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Yes. I want this over and done with.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I'll be waiting. And watching.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Why... her?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Her body pleases me.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: A brain. Extremities.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: This was not taken from a grave.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: What does it matter? She'll live again. You'll make her.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: No. I draw the line.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: You will honor your promise to me!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I will not! Kill me now!

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: That is mild compared to what will come. If you deny me my wedding night. I'll be with you on yours.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: She's beautiful.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: She's not for you.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: I'm sure the lady knows her own mind. Doesn't she? Let her decide the proper suitor.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: GET AWAY FROM HER! SHE'S MINE!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: SHE'LL NEVER BE YOURS! SHE SAID MY NAME! SHE REMEMBERS!

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Poor William! What indignant tears!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: There, there... shhh...

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: That's the nature of all progress, William. Don't let your brother sway you otherwise.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Quite right!

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Elizabeth, really! He's quite mad!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Scandalous! What would your dear mother say?

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: One-two-three, one-two-three, twirl- two-three...

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: You dance so beautifully together.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: And you look so lovely.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Must've been a terrible row.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: He was almost expelled for calling one of his professors a "pompous...  Fellow..."

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Nothing. Still nothing.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: It's been months. It's not like him.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Something's wrong. I know it.  I've heard rumors of cholera spreading south from Hamburg.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: So have I

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I should go. I should leave today.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Elizabeth. If it's true, travel into Germany would be banned. You'd never get near Ingolstadt.  Besides, they're only rumors.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: And not a word of them to Father. He's agitated enough not hearing from Victor.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Read him one of the old letters and rephrase it. We'll say it came today. It'll set his mind at ease.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: He always was opinionated.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: He set things right with a proper apology... and now they've put him in charge of dissection lab!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: What does it say?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Let this locket be a token of the vow we took the night I left.  He's coming home to marry me.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Have you seen Willie?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Is he not back yet?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Claude rode over there to see if held lost track of time. They say he never arrived.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It's far too late for him to still be out.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Don't cry, Elizabeth.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Aren't you?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Are you sure it can't hurt us?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Nothing can. Not ever.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: How could all my father's knowledge and skill fail to save her?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It's not ours to decide. All that live must die. It's God's will.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: What kind of God is He to will this?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: She was mother to me as well. But ours is the job of the living. It's up to us now to hold this family together. We must think of Father and be strong for him.  I cannot do that alone.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: God took her from us.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: He left a beautiful gift in her place. A baby boy. To cherish and love as our very own. Your brother

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Victor, have a care! You'll make him dizzy!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: The world is a dizzying place.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Oh, do give him here! He needs to be comforted and held!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: He needs to vent his outrage to the skies! Make yourself heard, Willie! Learning to walk is not an easy thing! Why should it be so?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Don't listen, Willie. Progress is a feast to be consumed. Women would have you believe you must walk before you can run. Or run before you can waltz!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Give me that child before you fill his head with drivel!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Smell the air. Wonderful.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Quite a send-off, isn't it?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Father's so proud.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: And you?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Prouder still. You'll be the handsomest student there.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I'll have to do better than that.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You will.  What do you want, Victor?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: To be the best there ever was. To push our knowledge beyond our dreams... to eradicate disease and pestilence... to purge mankind of ignorance and fear...

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I've loved you all my life

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: All my life I've known.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: This feels... incestuous.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Is that what makes it so delicious?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Brother and sister still?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I wish to be your husband.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I wish to be your wife.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Then come with me to Ingolstadt. Marry me now.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: If only I could. But one of us must stay. Father's not strong. Willie's just a child. Who can look after them in your absence? Who can run the estate?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Only you.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I will be here when you return.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: You make me weak.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Not as weak as I.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Our decision. Together.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Your decision. For us.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I give you my soul...

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: ...until our wedding night. When our bodies will join.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Victor. I love you,

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Elizabeth. My more than sister.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: My mind was not playing tricks. He was there in the storm... gloating over his crimes... challenging me to come.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: But why risk yourself? Hasn't this family suffered enough?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I've no choice

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: If what you say is true, it is a matter for the police!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: They've done a fine job. Hanging an innocent for the crime of a fiend.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Do you know this man? Is there something between you?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I know only that he is a killer. And I shall bring back his carcass.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I thought I'd never see you again!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I'm all right. I'm safe,

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What sort of task?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It's not something I can explain now. Perhaps someday.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What of our marriage? Victor, we've had so much tragedy. I want this family to live again.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: So do I.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: We need each other now, I need your comfort and strength, not separation and solitude.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: A month at most, that's all I ask.  Elizabeth, please. Things have not yet resolved. I must take steps to see that they do. For our family's sake. For our sake.  You are life itself. We shall seal our vow. The moment I am done.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: No. Not tomorrow, not next week, Marry me today.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Why the change? What about your work?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It was misguided and pointless. Is your answer yes?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It is

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: We'll leave this afternoon, right after the ceremony. Pack only what you need.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Does this have something to do with that man you saw?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Yes. We're in danger here. Every moment we stay.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Victor, tell me why! Trust me!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I do. But you must trust me for now.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Brother and sister no more.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Now husband and wife.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I remember the first time I ever saw you. Crossing the floor of the grand ballroom with my parents at your side. So beautiful even then.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I have been waiting for this ever since.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Victor!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Open this door for no-one!

turns.speaker: GRIGORI
turns.text: It's going to ram us.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: It wouldn't dare.

turns.speaker: GRIGORI
turns.text: Captain, I implore you. The men are frightened and angry. They want your assurance.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: They knew the risks when they signed on. I've come too far to turn back now.

turns.speaker: GRIGORI
turns.text: Then you run the danger of pushing them to mutiny.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: A warming wind.

turns.speaker: GRIGORI
turns.text: This ice will break yet.  How's our guest?

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: He died. Raving about phantoms. He was mad, poor devil.  Gather a detail. Have the body removed from my cabin.

turns.speaker: GRIGORI
turns.text: Aye, Captain.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: I'm quite serious. Look at all the charity and clinic work we do. Up until thirty years ago, the concept of vaccine was unheard of.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You're saying all disease will eventually be eradicated?

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: I'm convinced. Not by treating symptoms, but by diving nature's most jealously-guarded secrets.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Do you foresee this happening in our lifetimes?

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: No. But someday.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Thank goodness. We'd be out of work.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Professor?

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Oh God.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I was just clearing my throat.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Very well then.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I am not mad.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: As a march hare.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Are you having me on?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Of course I am. It pays to humor the insane.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Henry Clerval.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Victor, Victor Frankenstein.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I know. You have a way of making an impression.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Do you really think I'm mad?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Come now. Magnus? Agrippa? Next thing you know, you'll be teaching toadstools to speak.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Rich old ladies and their daughters?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Can you think of a better reason?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Quite a few.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Do me a favor then...  ...keep them to yourself.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: The entire school heard it. It wasn't something one could miss.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: You're a comfort to me, Henry.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What now? Writing about it in your journal won't help.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It's a letter to my father.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Now you've got him started.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: These are exciting times, Henry. We're entering an era of amazing breakthroughs. Look at Edward Jenner. He wasn't content to bleed people with leeches, he pioneered a new frontier of thought

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: ...yes, and thanks to him, smallpox has been virtually eliminated. I've heard this speech before.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: But you haven't listened, Never in history has so much seemed possible. We're on the verge of answers undreamt of... but only if we have the courage to ask the questions.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Only you would think of that!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Somebody has to!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: And here's to Him. Everything in moderation, Frankenstein.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Nothing in moderation, Clerval.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: They just caught the man who did it.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: He was a frightened soul who acted out of fear and ignorance.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: They'll hang him all the same.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Good. I'll be there to hear his worthless neck snap.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Keep your voice down. You don't know what you're saying.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It was wrong, Henry! It shouldn't have happened! The bastard deserves to die.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You're making a scene!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Why Waldman? He of all people should have cheated death!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: You can't. Death is God's will!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I resent God's monopoly.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: That's blasphemy!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Blasphemy be damned! Waldman spent his life trying to help people!

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: All the more reason for us to continue his work with the poor!

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: No. He had more important work.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: There are sick people who need our help. Here and now. Not in some future time. Consider that.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Victor. This has got to stop.  Nobody's seen you in months. You haven't attended a single class.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I've been preoccupied.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: We all know how hard you took Waldman's death. Even Krempe is sympathetic. But it is time to move on. It is time to concern yourself with life.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: That is my concern.  I'm involved in something just now. I want to finish it in Waldman's memory.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: How much longer?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Few months perhaps. I'm gathering the raw materials even now.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: This is a bad time, Henry. I'm busy just now. What do you want?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Things have gone worse with this cholera outbreak. Thousand new cases a day now. Classes have been suspended. University's shut down.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Yes? And?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Listen to what I'm saying. The militia's arriving to quarantine the city. Most of us are getting out while we still can.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: You'll be leaving then.  Just as well. You never were cut out for this, Henry. Goodbye.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Thank God your fever broke.  Slowly, now. Just a sip.  I've been worried we might lose you. It's been touch-and-go for a week.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: A... week?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: We feared cholera. Turned out to be pneumonia, brought on by nervous exhaustion and some idiot running around in a storm.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Is that your diagnosis?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Mine and Professor Krempe's.  We've been trading off nursing you in shifts. The rest of the time we're out working with the cholera victims. It's his turn for that just now.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: You've been going round-the-clock?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: We catch a few hours sleep where we can. Usually here at your bedside.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Everything in moderation, Clerval.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Nothing in moderation, Frankenstein.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It's the down-and-outs I pity most. Those who can't fend for themselves. They'll be dead by the thousands before this is done. They don't stand a chance out there.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: No. They don't.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Victor. This place looked like a charnel house. What went on here?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Quite a place.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Thank you, Henry.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: This. My home. My family.  If not for you, I'd be dead in a burial pit somewhere.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: What happened up there?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I didn't find what I was looking for.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Are you sure you'll be all right?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Yes, don't worry. I'll look after your father. You look after her.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I'll be back as soon as I've got her far away and safe. We'll hunt this fiend down together.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Only if you'll tell me who he is.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I owe you that. Done.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: All that I once loved lies in a shallow grave. By my hand.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Let it go.

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Yes. I took refuge in the barn. Wouldn't you? Lost in the storm? Freezing and wet? I was exhausted and could search no longer.

turns.speaker: PROSECUTOR
turns.text: And is it true, Miss Moritz, that you love Victor Frankenstein? That your heart was broken?  Answer the question. Do you love Victor Frankenstein?

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: I have always loved him.

turns.speaker: PROSECUTOR
turns.text: Is it also not true that you murdered his brother William in a misdirected crime of passion?

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: Murder Willie? In my heart, he was our child. Victor's and mine. Such a thing could never have entered my mind.

turns.speaker: PROSECUTOR
turns.text: So you have claimed. Yet you have no explanation for this.  The locket last seen in the hands of the poor murdered child was found hidden in your dress the morning following the murder. The locket you so coveted.  How did it come to be in your possession?

turns.speaker: JUSTINE
turns.text: I have no knowledge of that.

turns.speaker: KREMPE
turns.text: In science, the letter of fact is the letter of law. Our pursuit is as dogmatic as any religious precept. Think of yourselves as disciples of a strict and hallowed sect. Someday you may be priests... but only if you learn the scripture chapter and verse.  Any questions?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: But surely, Professor, you don't intend we disregard the more... philosophical works.

turns.speaker: KREMPE
turns.text: Philosophical?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Those which stir the imagination as well as the intellect. Paracelsus, for one.

turns.speaker: KREMPE
turns.text: Paracelsus?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Or Albertus Magnus. Cornelius Agrippa...

turns.speaker: KREMPE
turns.text: What is your name?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Victor Frankenstein, sir.  Of geneva.

turns.speaker: KREMPE
turns.text: Of Geneva.  Tell me, Mr. Frankenstein of Geneva. Do you wish to study medicine? Or mysticism?

turns.speaker: KREMPE
turns.text: You seem to be adapting well to the approved curriculum.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Despite the lack of challenge.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Professor Waldman.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Victor, explain yourself.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Krempe has a way of provoking my temper.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: You have a way of provoking his.  I've been watching you. You seem impatient with your studies.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: To say the least. I came here to expand my mind, but honest inquiry seems strangled at every turn. All we do is cling to the old knowledge instead of seeking the new.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: You disdain accepted wisdom?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: No, I embrace it... as something to be used or discarded as we advance the boundaries of what is known.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Preposterous.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: I once saw it done, as a boy in Canton. My parents were missionaries. The cure was nothing short of miraculous.  I've never forgotten it. Been fascinated ever since.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Electricity.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: It's utterly fantastic! This is the sort of thing I'm talking about! We should be learning this!

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Why? God alone knows what it means. Until it has proven value, it's nothing more than a ghoulish parlor trick. Hardly fit for the classroom.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: But the possibilities. Combining ancient knowledge with new? Something like this could change our fundamental views!

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: It is a thrilling direction to explore. Thrilling and dangerous.  Nature can be wonderful and terrible. Science is not a realm for the reckless; it needs a conscience. We must proceed cautiously. Assess as we go.  What I do on my own time is my own business. The same holds true for you. You wish to expand your mind? Fine, do so. You can even join me here, if you like. But not at the expense of your normal studies.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I doubt that decision is still mine to make.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Nonsense. Tonight you will draft an apology to Professor Krempe...

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: "...a sincere and heartfelt apology which you will then read aloud to him before the assembled student body and faculty.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Our profession needs talent like yours. Destroy your career over an issue of pride? What a waste.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Re-configure the leads?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Numbers four and twelve directly into the nervous system?

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Victor. He was trying to be gracious.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: The strain was evident.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I tell you what we need, my friends. Forget the symptoms and diseases. What we need is a vaccine for death itself.

turns.speaker: WALDMAN
turns.text: Oh, now you have gone too far. There's only one God, Victor.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: You're awake. I've prepared some broth. It'll help restore you.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I'm... dying.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Frostbite. Gangrene. A simple diagnosis.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Are you a physician?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: How is it you come to be here?

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: There's a startling question, coming from you.  I'm captain of this ship. We sailed from Archangel a month ago, seeking a passage to the North Pole.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Ah. An explorer.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Would-be. I'm plagued with my share of difficulties just at the moment.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: I heard.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: I can't say I blame them. We're trapped in this ice and bedeviled by some sort of... creature.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Creature? A... human like creature?

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: You know of it?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Your men are right to be afraid.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Then explain it, whatever it is. It could save the voyage. I've spent years planning this. My entire fortune.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: You'd persist at the cost of your own life? The lives of your crew?

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Lives are ephemeral. The knowledge we gain, the achievements we leave behind... those live on.

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: Do you share my madness?

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Madness?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: We are kindred, you and I. Men of ambition. Let me tell you all that I have lost in such pursuits. I pray my story will come to mean for you all that is capricious and evil in man.

turns.speaker: WALTON
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: VICTOR
turns.text: My name is Frankenstein...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He's dead... She's dead... all dead... Please save me... oh... poor Bill... Oh my God, oh my God... oh God...

turns.speaker: MRS. VOORHEES
turns.text: It will be all right. I'll take care of you.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Jack? Marcie? Ned?

turns.speaker: MRS. VOORHEES
turns.text: It's just this place. The storm. That's why you're all upset.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No, no, they're all dead...

turns.speaker: MRS. VOORHEES
turns.text: So young, so pretty. What monster could have done such a thing?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Bill -- Bill -- Bill is out there...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: The killer is still out there.

turns.speaker: MRS. VOORHEES
turns.text: I will protect you.

turns.speaker: MRS. VOORHEES
turns.text: We should go now.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Maybe we should wait for Mr. Christy.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: What'd you see?

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: I don't know. Marcie's got me paranoid.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Shows how much you know. It's something about tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Tomorrow is another day.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Right! Right!

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Melvin Belli.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I was careless.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I think we should go wake them up. Just in case.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Give them a little while longer. It's still early, anyway.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I guess...
